Objectives.Name: Fishing Pole - Get the Brig Key

Entries.Narrative:
Use the fishing pole to get the key from the dog. Use the key from the dog and open the brig door. Solve the crossword puzzle, turn it sideways, compare to chart on wall, it shows SALT. SALT opens word lock on small gray box. Look in the small wooden cube for the shape of four islands. Refer to the islands on the wall in that order:
Antigua 8
Barbados 7
Jamaica 9
Trinidad 4
 Opens black lock on box with studs. Knot clock has knots corresponding to time. Knots are shown in the back of the wine holder. 4x3 grid of circles shows which ones to do in which order. The positions on the clock correspond to the hours on the clock - you get 5817. Nautical Flags: Look up the order of the flags for the direction and count for the directional lock, which is RIght 4, Left 1, Up 6, Right 3, Left 2. THe cypher wheel requires you to set up the cyphers like this:
For the first word, Cyphers should be ordered 
C (arrow on 4)
B (arrow on 5)
A (arrow on 8)
Then the combinations are C6 (look at A), Cn (look at B) CV (Look at B), C7 (Look at B), CY (Look at A) - CROSS

FOr the second one, place the gears:
A (arrow on 7)
C (arrow on 5)
B (arrow on 3)
B6->C, Bk->C, BA->A, BJ->C, B8->A (BONES)

The two word locks on the half barrel are CROSS and BONES. Once you've opened the porthole door, press the letters in order SHIPWRECK. THis opens the last door. On the captain's desk is a wooden box with 3 coins and jewels.Using the coins found in a previous chest, count the number of jewels on specific coins gold black, silver in order that is on the box. There are 4, 3 and 1 jewels.

Use the fishing pole to get the key from the dog. Solve the crossword puzzle, turn it sideways, compare to chart on wall, it shows SALT. SALT opens word lock on small gray box. Look in the small wooden cube for the shape of four islands. Refer to the islands on the wall in that order:
Antigua 8
Barbados 7
Jamaica 9
Trinidad 4
 Opens black lock on box with studs. Knot clock has knots corresponding to time. Knots are shown in the back of the wine holder. 4x3 grid of circles shows which ones to do in which order. The positions on the clock correspond to the hours on the clock - you get 5817. THe cypher wheel requires you to set up the cyphers like this:
For the first word, Cyphers should be ordered 
C (arrow on 4)
B (arrow on 5)
A (arrow on 8)
Then the combinations are C6 (look at A), Cn (look at B) CV (Look at B), C7 (Look at B), CY (Look at A) - CROSS

FOr the second one, place the gears:
A (arrow on 7)
C (arrow on 5)
B (arrow on 3)
B6->C, Bk->C, BA->A, BJ->C, B8->A (BONES)

The two word locks on the half barrel are CROSS and BONES. Once you've opened the porthole door, press the letters in order SHIPWRECK. THis opens the last door. On the captain's desk is a wooden box with 3 coins and jewels.Using the coins found in a previous chest, count the number of jewels on specific coins gold black, silver in order that is on the box. There are 4, 3 and 1 jewels. Use the bellows found earlier to blow the sand away from the sand puzzle to reveal 24 R (HearT). Set the wheel so that the 24, R, and (heart) line up. Then the bottom of the jeweled box shows symbols which correspond to B T X and 8-26-4. Use this to open the desk drawer with BTX using combination 8-26-4 on the lock. Assemble 15 pieces into a map. Pull down the sail and sail the ship to the 3 islands - Cartegena (lower left),  Port Royale (Center, upper left), and San Juan (far right). 

The first two islands yield the audio "AHOY". The third island yields "shiver me timbers" and opens the trunk and ends the game.

Objectives.Name: Fishing Pole - Get the Brig Key

Entries.Narrative:
Use the key from the dog and open the brig door. Use the fishing pole to get the key from the dog. Knot clock has knots corresponding to time. Knots are shown in the back of the wine holder. 4x3 grid of circles shows which ones to do in which order. The positions on the clock correspond to the hours on the clock - you get 5817. Look in the small wooden cube for the shape of four islands. Refer to the islands on the wall in that order:
Antigua 8
Barbados 7
Jamaica 9
Trinidad 4
 Opens black lock on box with studs. Solve the crossword puzzle, turn it sideways, compare to chart on wall, it shows SALT. SALT opens word lock on small gray box. THe cypher wheel requires you to set up the cyphers like this:
For the first word, Cyphers should be ordered 
C (arrow on 4)
B (arrow on 5)
A (arrow on 8)
Then the combinations are C6 (look at A), Cn (look at B) CV (Look at B), C7 (Look at B), CY (Look at A) - CROSS

FOr the second one, place the gears:
A (arrow on 7)
C (arrow on 5)
B (arrow on 3)
B6->C, Bk->C, BA->A, BJ->C, B8->A (BONES)

The two word locks on the half barrel are CROSS and BONES. Once you've opened the porthole door, press the letters in order SHIPWRECK. THis opens the last door.

Logs.Message: Auto Triggered: Start Game - On Running
Auto Triggered: Brig opened - prisoners escaped
Objective 'Fishing Pole - Get the Brig Key' completed

GM Sent Clue: You're ready to set sail! Use the left rope to reverse, the right rope to go forward, and spin the wheel the direction you want to turn! Keep in mind, the ship can't turn and move at the same time! You'll need to dock at EACH port as shown on the map, starting by going to Cartagena. You'll hear AHOY when you've successfully docked!

Then the bottom of the jeweled box shows symbols which correspond to B T X and 8-26-4. Use this to open the desk drawer with BTX using combination 8-26-4 on the lock. Assemble 15 pieces into a map.

The first two islands yield the audio "AHOY". The third island yields "shiver me timbers" and opens the trunk and ends the game.

B (arrow on 3)
B6->C, Bk->C, BA->A, BJ->C, B8->A (BONES)

The two word locks on the half barrel are CROSS and BONES. Once you've opened the porthole door, press the letters in order SHIPWRECK. THis opens the last door. On the captain's desk is a wooden box with 3 coins and jewels.Using the coins found in a previous chest, count the number of jewels on specific coins gold black, silver in order that is on the box. There are 4, 3 and 1 jewels. Use the bellows found earlier to blow the sand away from the sand puzzle to reveal 24 R (HearT).

Objectives.Name: Fishing Pole - Get the Brig Key

Entries.Narrative:
Use the fishing pole to get the key from the dog. Use the key from the dog and open the brig door. Solve the crossword puzzle, turn it sideways, compare to chart on wall, it shows SALT. SALT opens word lock on small gray box. Look in the small wooden cube for the shape of four islands. Refer to the islands on the wall in that order:
Antigua 8
Barbados 7
Jamaica 9
Trinidad 4
 Opens black lock on box with studs. THe cypher wheel requires you to set up the cyphers like this:
For the first word, Cyphers should be ordered 
C (arrow on 4)
B (arrow on 5)
A (arrow on 8)
Then the combinations are C6 (look at A), Cn (look at B) CV (Look at B), C7 (Look at B), CY (Look at A) - CROSS

FOr the second one, place the gears:
A (arrow on 7)
C (arrow on 5)
B (arrow on 3)
B6->C, Bk->C, BA->A, BJ->C, B8->A (BONES)

The two word locks on the half barrel are CROSS and BONES. Knot clock has knots corresponding to time. Knots are shown in the back of the wine holder. 4x3 grid of circles shows which ones to do in which order. The positions on the clock correspond to the hours on the clock - you get 5817. Once you've opened the porthole door, press the letters in order SHIPWRECK. THis opens the last door. On the captain's desk is a wooden box with 3 coins and jewels.Using the coins found in a previous chest, count the number of jewels on specific coins gold black, silver in order that is on the box. There are 4, 3 and 1 jewels. Use the bellows found earlier to blow the sand away from the sand puzzle to reveal 24 R (HearT). Set the wheel so that the 24, R, and (heart) line up. Then the bottom of the jeweled box shows symbols which correspond to B T X and 8-26-4. Use this to open the desk drawer with BTX using combination 8-26-4 on the lock. Assemble 15 pieces into a map.

Barbados 7
Jamaica 9
Trinidad 4
 Opens black lock on box with studs. THe cypher wheel requires you to set up the cyphers like this:
For the first word, Cyphers should be ordered 
C (arrow on 4)
B (arrow on 5)
A (arrow on 8)
Then the combinations are C6 (look at A), Cn (look at B) CV (Look at B), C7 (Look at B), CY (Look at A) - CROSS

FOr the second one, place the gears:
A (arrow on 7)
C (arrow on 5)
B (arrow on 3)
B6->C, Bk->C, BA->A, BJ->C, B8->A (BONES)

The two word locks on the half barrel are CROSS and BONES. Knot clock has knots corresponding to time. Knots are shown in the back of the wine holder. 4x3 grid of circles shows which ones to do in which order. The positions on the clock correspond to the hours on the clock - you get 5817. Once you've opened the porthole door, press the letters in order SHIPWRECK. THis opens the last door. Use the bellows found earlier to blow the sand away from the sand puzzle to reveal 24 R (HearT). On the captain's desk is a wooden box with 3 coins and jewels.Using the coins found in a previous chest, count the number of jewels on specific coins gold black, silver in order that is on the box. There are 4, 3 and 1 jewels. Set the wheel so that the 24, R, and (heart) line up. Then the bottom of the jeweled box shows symbols which correspond to B T X and 8-26-4. Use this to open the desk drawer with BTX using combination 8-26-4 on the lock. Assemble 15 pieces into a map.

Jamaica 9
Trinidad 4
 Opens black lock on box with studs. Solve the crossword puzzle, turn it sideways, compare to chart on wall, it shows SALT. SALT opens word lock on small gray box. Knot clock has knots corresponding to time. Knots are shown in the back of the wine holder. 4x3 grid of circles shows which ones to do in which order. The positions on the clock correspond to the hours on the clock - you get 5817. THe cypher wheel requires you to set up the cyphers like this:
For the first word, Cyphers should be ordered 
C (arrow on 4)
B (arrow on 5)
A (arrow on 8)
Then the combinations are C6 (look at A), Cn (look at B) CV (Look at B), C7 (Look at B), CY (Look at A) - CROSS

FOr the second one, place the gears:
A (arrow on 7)
C (arrow on 5)
B (arrow on 3)
B6->C, Bk->C, BA->A, BJ->C, B8->A (BONES)

The two word locks on the half barrel are CROSS and BONES. Once you've opened the porthole door, press the letters in order SHIPWRECK. THis opens the last door. On the captain's desk is a wooden box with 3 coins and jewels.Using the coins found in a previous chest, count the number of jewels on specific coins gold black, silver in order that is on the box. There are 4, 3 and 1 jewels. Use the bellows found earlier to blow the sand away from the sand puzzle to reveal 24 R (HearT). Set the wheel so that the 24, R, and (heart) line up. Then the bottom of the jeweled box shows symbols which correspond to B T X and 8-26-4. Use this to open the desk drawer with BTX using combination 8-26-4 on the lock. Assemble 15 pieces into a map.

Pull down the sail and sail the ship to the 3 islands - Cartegena (lower left),  Port Royale (Center, upper left), and San Juan (far right). 

The first two islands yield the audio "AHOY". The third island yields "shiver me timbers" and opens the trunk and ends the game.

On the captain's desk is a wooden box with 3 coins and jewels.Using the coins found in a previous chest, count the number of jewels on specific coins gold black, silver in order that is on the box. Then the bottom of the jeweled box shows symbols which correspond to B T X and 8-26-4. Use this to open the desk drawer with BTX using combination 8-26-4 on the lock. Assemble 15 pieces into a map.

Entries.Narrative:
Use the fishing pole to get the key from the dog. Use the key from the dog and open the brig door. Look in the small wooden cube for the shape of four islands. Refer to the islands on the wall in that order:
Antigua 8
Barbados 7
Jamaica 9
Trinidad 4
 Opens black lock on box with studs. Knot clock has knots corresponding to time. Knots are shown in the back of the wine holder. 4x3 grid of circles shows which ones to do in which order. The positions on the clock correspond to the hours on the clock - you get 5817. Solve the crossword puzzle, turn it sideways, compare to chart on wall, it shows SALT. SALT opens word lock on small gray box. THe cypher wheel requires you to set up the cyphers like this:
For the first word, Cyphers should be ordered 
C (arrow on 4)
B (arrow on 5)
A (arrow on 8)
Then the combinations are C6 (look at A), Cn (look at B) CV (Look at B), C7 (Look at B), CY (Look at A) - CROSS

C (arrow on 5)
B (arrow on 3)

Look in the small wooden cube for the shape of four islands. Refer to the islands on the wall in that order:
Antigua 8
Barbados 7
Jamaica 9
Trinidad 4
 Opens black lock on box with studs. Nautical Flags: Look up the order of the flags for the direction and count for the directional lock, which is RIght 4, Left 1, Up 6, Right 3, Left 2. Solve the crossword puzzle, turn it sideways, compare to chart on wall, it shows SALT. SALT opens word lock on small gray box. THe cypher wheel requires you to set up the cyphers like this:
For the first word, Cyphers should be ordered 
C (arrow on 4)
B (arrow on 5)
A (arrow on 8)
Then the combinations are C6 (look at A), Cn (look at B) CV (Look at B), C7 (Look at B), CY (Look at A) - CROSS

FOr the second one, place the gears:
A (arrow on 7)
C (arrow on 5)
B (arrow on 3)
B6->C, Bk->C, BA->A, BJ->C, B8->A (BONES)

The two word locks on the half barrel are CROSS and BONES. Once you've opened the porthole door, press the letters in order SHIPWRECK. THis opens the last door. On the captain's desk is a wooden box with 3 coins and jewels.Using the coins found in a previous chest, count the number of jewels on specific coins gold black, silver in order that is on the box. There are 4, 3 and 1 jewels. Use the bellows found earlier to blow the sand away from the sand puzzle to reveal 24 R (HearT). Set the wheel so that the 24, R, and (heart) line up. Then the bottom of the jeweled box shows symbols which correspond to B T X and 8-26-4. Use this to open the desk drawer with BTX using combination 8-26-4 on the lock. Assemble 15 pieces into a map.

Pull down the sail and sail the ship to the 3 islands - Cartegena (lower left),  Port Royale (Center, upper left), and San Juan (far right). 

The first two islands yield the audio "AHOY". The third island yields "shiver me timbers" and opens the trunk and ends the game.

Objectives.Name: Fishing Pole - Get the Brig Key

Entries.Narrative:
Use the key from the dog and open the brig door. Solve the crossword puzzle, turn it sideways, compare to chart on wall, it shows SALT. SALT opens word lock on small gray box. Look in the small wooden cube for the shape of four islands. Refer to the islands on the wall in that order:
Antigua 8
Barbados 7
Jamaica 9
Trinidad 4
 Opens black lock on box with studs. Knot clock has knots corresponding to time. Knots are shown in the back of the wine holder. 4x3 grid of circles shows which ones to do in which order. The positions on the clock correspond to the hours on the clock - you get 5817. Use the fishing pole to get the key from the dog. Nautical Flags: Look up the order of the flags for the direction and count for the directional lock, which is RIght 4, Left 1, Up 6, Right 3, Left 2. THe cypher wheel requires you to set up the cyphers like this:

C (arrow on 4)
B (arrow on 5)
A (arrow on 8)
Then the combinations are C6 (look at A), Cn (look at B) CV (Look at B), C7 (Look at B), CY (Look at A) - CROSS

FOr the second one, place the gears:
A (arrow on 7)
C (arrow on 5)
B (arrow on 3)
B6->C, Bk->C, BA->A, BJ->C, B8->A (BONES)

The two word locks on the half barrel are CROSS and BONES. Once you've opened the porthole door, press the letters in order SHIPWRECK. THis opens the last door. Use the bellows found earlier to blow the sand away from the sand puzzle to reveal 24 R (HearT). On the captain's desk is a wooden box with 3 coins and jewels.Using the coins found in a previous chest, count the number of jewels on specific coins gold black, silver in order that is on the box. There are 4, 3 and 1 jewels.

Pull down the sail and sail the ship to the 3 islands - Cartegena (lower left),  Port Royale (Center, upper left), and San Juan (far right). 

The first two islands yield the audio "AHOY". The third island yields "shiver me timbers" and opens the trunk and ends the game.

Use the key from the dog and open the brig door. Use the fishing pole to get the key from the dog. Solve the crossword puzzle, turn it sideways, compare to chart on wall, it shows SALT. The positions on the clock correspond to the hours on the clock - you get 5817. Look in the small wooden cube for the shape of four islands. Refer to the islands on the wall in that order:
Antigua 8
Barbados 7
Jamaica 9
Trinidad 4

For the first word, Cyphers should be ordered 
C (arrow on 4)
B (arrow on 5)
A (arrow on 8)
Then the combinations are C6 (look at A), Cn (look at B) CV (Look at B), C7 (Look at B), CY (Look at A) - CROSS

FOr the second one, place the gears:
A (arrow on 7)
C (arrow on 5)
B (arrow on 3)
B6->C, Bk->C, BA->A, BJ->C, B8->A (BONES)

 Opens black lock on box with studs. Nautical Flags: Look up the order of the flags for the direction and count for the directional lock, which is RIght 4, Left 1, Up 6, Right 3, Left 2. Knot clock has knots corresponding to time. Knots are shown in the back of the wine holder. 4x3 grid of circles shows which ones to do in which order. The positions on the clock correspond to the hours on the clock - you get 5817. Solve the crossword puzzle, turn it sideways, compare to chart on wall, it shows SALT. SALT opens word lock on small gray box. THe cypher wheel requires you to set up the cyphers like this:
For the first word, Cyphers should be ordered 
C (arrow on 4)
B (arrow on 5)
A (arrow on 8)
Then the combinations are C6 (look at A), Cn (look at B) CV (Look at B), C7 (Look at B), CY (Look at A) - CROSS

FOr the second one, place the gears:
A (arrow on 7)
C (arrow on 5)
B (arrow on 3)

The two word locks on the half barrel are CROSS and BONES. Once you've opened the porthole door, press the letters in order SHIPWRECK. THis opens the last door. On the captain's desk is a wooden box with 3 coins and jewels.Using the coins found in a previous chest, count the number of jewels on specific coins gold black, silver in order that is on the box. There are 4, 3 and 1 jewels. Use the bellows found earlier to blow the sand away from the sand puzzle to reveal 24 R (HearT). Set the wheel so that the 24, R, and (heart) line up. Then the bottom of the jeweled box shows symbols which correspond to B T X and 8-26-4. Use this to open the desk drawer with BTX using combination 8-26-4 on the lock. Assemble 15 pieces into a map. Pull down the sail and sail the ship to the 3 islands - Cartegena (lower left),  Port Royale (Center, upper left), and San Juan (far right). 

The first two islands yield the audio "AHOY". The third island yields "shiver me timbers" and opens the trunk and ends the game.

On the captain's desk is a wooden box with 3 coins and jewels.Using the coins found in a previous chest, count the number of jewels on specific coins gold black, silver in order that is on the box. There are 4, 3 and 1 jewels. Assemble 15 pieces into a map. Pull down the sail and sail the ship to the 3 islands - Cartegena (lower left),  Port Royale (Center, upper left), and San Juan (far right). 

The first two islands yield the audio "AHOY". The third island yields "shiver me timbers" and opens the trunk and ends the game.

Use the fishing pole to get the key from the dog. Use the key from the dog and open the brig door. Nautical Flags: Look up the order of the flags for the direction and count for the directional lock, which is RIght 4, Left 1, Up 6, Right 3, Left 2. Solve the crossword puzzle, turn it sideways, compare to chart on wall, it shows SALT. SALT opens word lock on small gray box. Knot clock has knots corresponding to time. Knots are shown in the back of the wine holder. 4x3 grid of circles shows which ones to do in which order. The positions on the clock correspond to the hours on the clock - you get 5817. Look in the small wooden cube for the shape of four islands. Refer to the islands on the wall in that order:
Antigua 8
Barbados 7
Jamaica 9
Trinidad 4
 Opens black lock on box with studs. THe cypher wheel requires you to set up the cyphers like this:
For the first word, Cyphers should be ordered 
C (arrow on 4)
B (arrow on 5)
A (arrow on 8)
Then the combinations are C6 (look at A), Cn (look at B) CV (Look at B), C7 (Look at B), CY (Look at A) - CROSS

FOr the second one, place the gears:
A (arrow on 7)
C (arrow on 5)
B (arrow on 3)
B6->C, Bk->C, BA->A, BJ->C, B8->A (BONES)

The two word locks on the half barrel are CROSS and BONES. Once you've opened the porthole door, press the letters in order SHIPWRECK. THis opens the last door. On the captain's desk is a wooden box with 3 coins and jewels.Using the coins found in a previous chest, count the number of jewels on specific coins gold black, silver in order that is on the box. There are 4, 3 and 1 jewels. Use the bellows found earlier to blow the sand away from the sand puzzle to reveal 24 R (HearT). Set the wheel so that the 24, R, and (heart) line up. Then the bottom of the jeweled box shows symbols which correspond to B T X and 8-26-4. Use this to open the desk drawer with BTX using combination 8-26-4 on the lock. Assemble 15 pieces into a map.
